thread.title: Bienville Club President's Ball presents 17 young ladies
thread.title_full: Bienville Club President's Ball presents 17 young ladies | NOLA.com

author: Sue Strachan, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Bienville Club President's Ball presents 17 young ladies
text:
For 17 young women, the evening of Friday (Oct. 9) was no doubt a special occasion, one that imbued a custom held dear to their families.
Le Moyne de Bienville Club (named after the city's founder, Jean-Baptiste Le Moyne, Sieur de Bienville) has maintained a tradition that started in 1964, when it was founded: presenting members' daughters or granddaughters.
New Orleans Country Club was site for the 2015 President's Ball and Presentation where the young ladies -- who wore long white dresses and kid-leather, white opera-length gloves while holding posies of red roses -- were presented to members and their wives. Each walked out to a different song, performed by the Jimmy Maxwell Orchestra, which also played at the reception afterwards.
This year's group included Misses Claire Elizabeth Bermudez, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rafael Adam Bermudez; Katherine Michelle Bickham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Andrew Bickham; Margot Louise Childs, daughter of Mr. Scott Childs and Mrs. Suzanne Burns Childs; Emma Marks Conroy , daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Kenneth Conroy; Juby Adair de la Houssaye, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Michael de la Houssaye; Shea Hodges Duckworth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick Shea Duckworth; Emily Elizabeth Frischhertz , daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kevin James Frischhertz; Isabel Catherine Gibson, daughter of Mr. Charles Michael Gibson and Ms. Nicole A. Chauppette; Madeleine DeHaven Landry , daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bryan Scott Landry; Lauren Lee Paysse, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ren√© Sylvain Paysse Jr.; Chloe Margaret Pelitere, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Lucovic Pelitere; Paris Kelly Reso , Mr. and Mrs. Patrick K. Reso; and Amanda Elizabeth Reso, Mr. and Mrs. Robert R. Reso; Jessica Carter Schaumburg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Seth Holden Schaumburg; Elizabeth Colon Toso, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Joseph Toso III; Katherine Elizabeth Verlander , daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Timothy Gordon Verlander; and Sarah Grace Young, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Leslie Young.
Their fathers escorted the young ladies for the presentation, except for Miss Childs and Misses Resos: their grandfathers, Mr. Donald Ogden Collins Sr. and Mr. Jerome John Reso Jr, respectively, had the honor.
This was the first ball as Bienville Club President for James Wilbert , who was accompanied by his wife, Kathleen Wilbert . Benjamin Janke was the Ball Chairman again; his wife, Elizabeth Janke, accompanied him.
